Email title:
Complaint towards CAAC's order on restricting Cathay Pacific's use of the China Airspace due to its practitioners' political views

範本喺下面!

Sir,

A number of incidents related to the silencing of the freedom of speech of airline services providers in Hong Kong are to be alarming and awaiting the immediate response of the International Air Transport Association.

The Hong Kong Airport Services Ltd, Cathay Pacific and Cathay Dragon have been diligently providing world-class professional services to support the smooth and safe operations of the Hong Kong Airport, one of the busiest and the most reliable ones in the world. Some of their loyal employees, despite having a pro-democratic stance and participating in the peaceful protests against the Hong Kong government, continued to dedicate themselves in safeguarding the interests of airline passengers.

However, the Civil Aviation Administration of China has pressured these three parties to forcefully prohibit their employees to express their political voice in peaceful protests or on social media. It demanded to be shown crew lists for all Cathay flights going over mainland Chinese airspace, making clear that any crew member involved in the protests would not be allowed to fly. The recent resignation of the Cathay Pacific Group CEO Rupert Hogg and his deputy, Paul Loo Kar-pui, and the unwarranted dismissal of Cathay Pacific and Cathay Dragon pilots and stewards are casting a white terror on other remaining practitioners.

Every member of the airline industry should be entitled to the basic right of freedom of speech based on facts and reality. It is up to the IATA to scrutinize this series of events, reconsider the justification of the CAAC to illegitimately control their airspace based on politics but not the actual performance of providers and penalize it for such outrageous behavior.

May the IATA remain to be the creditable organization protecting all airline practitioners and passengers. I look forward to hearing from your prompt reply.

Yours faithfully,
A Hong Kong citizen
